alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:52AM PST until January 08 at 12:11AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Doty affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain over the Southwest Interior Thursday combined with lowland snow melt to push the Chehalis River above Doty above flood stage Thursday. The river has crested and will continue to recede today. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River Above Doty. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 318.0 feet, flood waters of the upper Chehalis and South Fork Chehalis will inundate many roads and some residential and commercial areas. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Curtis Hill...Lake Creek...Moon Hill...Wildwood Roads in the Boisfort Valley and Labri Rd. and Front St. below Doty. This stage roughly corresponds to just below Phase 2 in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM PST Friday the stage was 320.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM PST Friday was 321.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue receding tonight. - Flood stage is 318.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 200 PM PST.
